description: Demonstrations against the American president's authoritarian drift took place on the same day as the military parade Donald Trump had been wanting to organize since his first term in office.

Two Democratic lawmakers shot along with their spouses in their Minnesota homes; one couple dead
description: State representative Melissa Hortman and her husband Mark were killed at their home near Minneapolis, Governor Tim Walz told a press conference. State senator John Hoffman and his wife Yvette were shot and wounded.

headline: Sarkozy stripped of Legion of Honor
description: The decision to revoke the country's highest distinction was expected since Sarkozy's conviction for graft. President Emmanuel Macron said he was opposed to the move.

headline: Philosopher Emanuele Coccia and designer Alessandro Michele believe fashion deserves a place in the world of ideas. Here's why
description: Clothing has long been dismissed or overlooked by most thinkers. In 'The Life of Forms,' Coccia and Michele establish an interesting dialogue, demonstrating the transformative power of a discipline far more profound than it may seem.

headline: How Greenland tries to avoid the over-tourism trap
description: As the territory with a population of 56,500 prepares to welcome a record number of visitors this year, the Parliament has passed a law designed to encourage local businesses and limit the arrival of large cruise ships.

description: Faced with Israel, the Islamic Republic of Iran can no longer count on its allies in Lebanon, Iraq and Yemen, which have been weakened since Hamas's attack on Israel, on October 7, 2023.

headline: Thomas Piketty: 'Opponents of the tax on the ultra-wealthy lack historical perspective'
description: After France's Sénat voted against a 2% wealth tax for people whose worth exceeds €100 million, the economist argues that the scale of France's debt and funding needs for social and climate challenges will soon require even more radical redistributive measures.

headline: In Rome, Maria Grazia Chiuri's final bow
description: It was in her hometown that Dior's artistic director, Maria Grazia Chiuri, chose to stage her farewell show on May 27. Though nothing was revealed that day about her departure, the designer decided to celebrate the art and culture of the Italian capital, where she has just brought a small theater back to life near the Forum.
